channel.title: World at One: BBC Radio 4 News
channel.description: Forty five minutes of news, analysis and comment with Martha Kearney and Shaun Ley

item.title: WATO: Afghan Opium Boom
item.description: Afghanistan's farmers increase opium production, says UN; North Korea marks anniversary of founding father's birth; and Should owners of expensive properties in southern Europe be taxed to help pay for future Eurozone bailouts?
item.itunes:subtitle: Afghanistan's farmers increase opium production, says UN; North Korea marks anniversary of founding father's birth; and Should owners of expensive properties in southern Europe be taxed to help pay for future Eurozone bailouts?...
item.itunes:summary: Afghanistan's farmers increase opium production, says UN; North Korea marks anniversary of founding father's birth; and Should owners of expensive properties in southern Europe be taxed to help pay for future Eurozone bailouts?
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Cyprus in new bailout plea
item.description: Cypriot President writes to EU leaders to ask for more help, we hear from Nicosia, Dublin and Berlin; the latest row over the future of Leeds General Infirmary's child cardiac unit; and Former Radio 1 DJ on the Ding Dong Thatcher storm.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cypriot President writes to EU leaders to ask for more help, we hear from Nicosia, Dublin and Berlin; the latest row over the future of Leeds General Infirmary's child cardiac unit; and Former Radio 1 DJ on the Ding Dong Thatcher storm....
item.itunes:summary: Cypriot President writes to EU leaders to ask for more help, we hear from Nicosia, Dublin and Berlin; the latest row over the future of Leeds General Infirmary's child cardiac unit; and Former Radio 1 DJ on the Ding Dong Thatcher storm.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: North Korea threat
item.description: G8 leaders deal with North Korea; millions of cars recalled amid safety fears and we discuss can television documentaries change government policy?
item.itunes:subtitle: G8 leaders deal with North Korea; millions of cars recalled amid safety fears and we discuss can television documentaries change government policy?...
item.itunes:summary: G8 leaders deal with North Korea; millions of cars recalled amid safety fears and we discuss can television documentaries change government policy?
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Baroness Thatcher funeral plans
item.description: More details have been released about the funeral service for Baroness Thatcher; we also debate her legacy in Northern Ireland. We have the latest from North Korea and we look at Roman artefacts from the 'Pompei of the North'.
item.itunes:subtitle: More details have been released about the funeral service for Baroness Thatcher; we also debate her legacy in Northern Ireland. We have the latest from North Korea and we look at Roman artefacts from the 'Pompei of the North'....
item.itunes:summary: More details have been released about the funeral service for Baroness Thatcher; we also debate her legacy in Northern Ireland. We have the latest from North Korea and we look at Roman artefacts from the 'Pompei of the North'.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Baroness Thatcher death
item.description: How does the death of Margaret Thatcher impact contemporary politics? We hear from friends, opposition and the actress who played her on stage the night after her death was announced. We have the latest on the measles outbreak in South Wales, and we look at the devastating effect of the prolonged bad weather on wildlife across the country.
